title: Tips on getting an S with Kat?
body:
I realized a few weeks ago that Kat was my highest mastery champion (on my main) and decided to play something other than ARAM/ARURF so I could focus on that. Here are my last 13 Kat games (most recent first), "WL, grade, K/D/A, CS/minutes":

W, A+, 24/5/8, 166/37
W, B-, 5/4/1/87, 87/20
W, S-, 22/2/3, 143/29
W, B+, 8/3/3, 92/22
W, S-, 15/1/2, 113/22
L, B+, 8/3/5, 79/20
L, S-, 18/3/9, 208/37
W, ?, 8/3/10, 104/27
L, C+, 3/3/0, 62/16
W, C+, 3/3/8, 93/28
W, ?, 8/0/3, 122/22
W, ?, 21/1/9, 160/30
W, ?, 8/9/17, 69/15

I hit M5 with that most recent match, and M6 requires S- or better, twice (to say nothing of M7's S+ or better, three times). But, as you can see, my grades are usually mediocre.

Now, I'm fully aware that my CS is bad, basically topping out at 5/min. I'm trying to improve that, not only during lane phase but also later on when side lanes have lots of farm available. The problem I'm having with CS is that I sometimes have to choose between mindlessly split pushing for CS and joining my team for a teamfight, and the latter is usually preferable given Kat's strengths.

So. Any tips for getting those tokens? Focus more on CS and less on kills, ward more, maybe even switch to something kooky like bot lane APC Kat? Any advice welcome.

replies.body: CS is definitely the culprit here. As you are aware, 5 cs/min is bad. You seem to be mechanically skilled on Kat though given your K/D/A's, so that isn't a problem. I also play Katarina a lot and i was like you about a year ago. Good KDA, lots of kills, and winning lots of games, but bad CS. Only recently did I figure out how to balance between CS and trades in lane. It just takes practice and a lot of time to get down. But once you do, you'll be doing even better in your games.

> [{quoted}](name=Bent Pixels,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8VFGvaZ0,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2020-02-12T13:59:14.832+0000)
>
> CS is definitely the culprit here. As you are aware, 5 cs/min is bad. You seem to be mechanically skilled on Kat though given your K/D/A's, so that isn't a problem. I also play Katarina a lot and i was like you about a year ago. Good KDA, lots of kills, and winning lots of games, but bad CS. Only recently did I figure out how to balance between CS and trades in lane. It just takes practice and a lot of time to get down. But once you do, you'll be doing even better in your games.

I tried focusing more on CS and you're absolutely right. W, S-, 8/1/5, 155/24, and I was mid. That's nearly 6.5 CS/min when I usually top out at around 5. I suspect a low death count factors into it, as well.

> [{quoted}](name=Bent Pixels,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8VFGvaZ0,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2020-02-12T13:59:14.832+0000)
>
> CS is definitely the culprit here. As you are aware, 5 cs/min is bad. You seem to be mechanically skilled on Kat though given your K/D/A's, so that isn't a problem. I also play Katarina a lot and i was like you about a year ago. Good KDA, lots of kills, and winning lots of games, but bad CS. Only recently did I figure out how to balance between CS and trades in lane. It just takes practice and a lot of time to get down. But once you do, you'll be doing even better in your games.


> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8VFGvaZ0,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2020-02-13T04:49:05.600+0000)
>
> I tried focusing more on CS and you're absolutely right. W, S-, 8/1/5, 155/24, and I was mid. That's nearly 6.5 CS/min when I usually top out at around 5. I suspect a low death count factors into it, as well.

Yeah, but ADCs tend to just delete a wave before you can clear it because of the delays on your abilities. By end game almost everyone wave clears faster than you which is one reason why it's so hard to get an S-/S/S+. If other lanes won, you're just gonna sit at around 150-160 CS and barely move.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8VFGvaZ0,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2020-02-12T10:17:16.015+0000)
>
> That's a good point about taking kills. Kat isn't Pyke with extra gold everywhere, and I'm sure some ADCs won't be happy about it. I've been lucky so far, and all the ADCs I've supported appear to have been perfectly fine with it.
> 
> Also true about top being situational. I tried it a whopping one time. I suppose it was mostly the contrast between something that works at least once vs something that I will never do again (Kat jungle). The key for me was the mastery grade, since I'm trying for M6 right now.

Yeah, if you get a good matchup top can be really nice. If you get a not so good matchup, well....better luck next time, lol. I don't think very many are skill matchups. Riven is probably about the only one and that's only because you can E behind her Q3. If you're going into a really rough matchup it's sometimes better to just get the 3 anal beads and a pot and farm it out as best you can. You can avoid ganks better than a lot of other mid laners because of your E, but if your minion wave is pushed you're still gonna have a rough time. I haven't played Akali since her gutting, but I remember a long time ago I was playing Akali support and it worked REALLY well with a relic shield start.

Apparently, W, A+, 8/0/4, 121/20 is a thing. Only issue I can think of here is that I just didn't have enough raw score. Seems like every time I'm doing well and I think I'll get that token, the enemy can tell, too, and they FF.

How often do you ward? 

That is also part of grade.

> [{quoted}](name=Joe 2nd,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8VFGvaZ0,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2020-02-13T07:28:37.405+0000)
>
> How often do you ward? 
> 
> That is also part of grade.

Not often enough. Mostly if I want to be able to target something in brush.
Just tried bot Kat, kinda supporting, also kinda taking CS. W, A+, 9/6/14, 50/22. If _that's_ as close to an S- as W, A+, 24/5/8, 166/37, I think I know what I'll do.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8VFGvaZ0,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2020-02-12T04:25:23.739+0000)
>
> Just tried bot Kat, kinda supporting, also kinda taking CS. W, A+, 9/6/14, 50/22. If _that's_ as close to an S- as W, A+, 24/5/8, 166/37, I think I know what I'll do.

CS is mostly the problem, because her damage is so delayed an ADC will take your entire wave before you do your first Q>E. Bot is also an unusual position for Kat so you have a lot more potential to get an S there(not to mention no ADCs to take your waves). It's also EXTREMELY fun to play her in bot lane and not really troll at all. I played her bot quite a bit a while back and had a higher win rate than my mid lane win rate. That said, that was when Dark Harvest wasn't a troll rune and you could actually get some use out of it. I went with a lich bane build and it was extremely fun(sadly they destroyed Dark Harvest and the lich bane build isn't as useful).
JSYK, her best supports are something like a Leona or a Nami. Both are extremely helpful and if you both start ignite you can get an early double kill with a dark seal and really snowball from there. Leona and Nami are my favorite supports as bot lane Kat.

> [{quoted}](name=VoraciousX,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8VFGvaZ0,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2020-02-12T04:49:13.670+0000)
>
> CS is mostly the problem, because her damage is so delayed an ADC will take your entire wave before you do your first Q>E. Bot is also an unusual position for Kat so you have a lot more potential to get an S there(not to mention no ADCs to take your waves). It's also EXTREMELY fun to play her in bot lane and not really troll at all. I played her bot quite a bit a while back and had a higher win rate than my mid lane win rate. That said, that was when Dark Harvest wasn't a troll rune and you could actually get some use out of it. I went with a lich bane build and it was extremely fun(sadly they destroyed Dark Harvest and the lich bane build isn't as useful).
> JSYK, her best supports are something like a Leona or a Nami. Both are extremely helpful and if you both start ignite you can get an early double kill with a dark seal and really snowball from there. Leona and Nami are my favorite supports as bot lane Kat.

I've actually supported as Kat for a few games. Seems okay. I'll go full APC when I get a chance.

Jungle Kat, on the other hand... Smite should be greyed out for Kat at champ select, honestly.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8VFGvaZ0,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2020-02-12T06:13:28.994+0000)
>
> I've actually supported as Kat for a few games. Seems okay. I'll go full APC when I get a chance.
> 
> Jungle Kat, on the other hand... Smite should be greyed out for Kat at champ select, honestly.

I don't like to support Kat cuz ADCs are dicks most of the time and want all their kills and I have no CC to help them get it, not really good if you don't get the kills either. I agree on jungle Kat. I made it work one game but it was boring and I power farmed all game mostly and just got lucky picks.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8VFGvaZ0,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2020-02-12T06:55:37.384+0000)
>
> Just learned that top Kat works fine for winning, but not for grades. W, A, 15/4/3, 107/24. I think the optimal place is bot.

Top is situational. Depends on champion you're facing. Some champs just do a lot to counter her.

> [{quoted}](name=VoraciousX,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8VFGvaZ0,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2020-02-12T09:51:07.098+0000)
>
> I don't like to support Kat cuz ADCs are dicks most of the time and want all their kills and I have no CC to help them get it, not really good if you don't get the kills either. I agree on jungle Kat. I made it work one game but it was boring and I power farmed all game mostly and just got lucky picks.
> 
> Top is situational. Depends on champion you're facing. Some champs just do a lot to counter her.

That's a good point about taking kills. Kat isn't Pyke with extra gold everywhere, and I'm sure some ADCs won't be happy about it. I've been lucky so far, and all the ADCs I've supported appear to have been perfectly fine with it.

Also true about top being situational. I tried it a whopping one time. I suppose it was mostly the contrast between something that works at least once vs something that I will never do again (Kat jungle). The key for me was the mastery grade, since I'm trying for M6 right now.
Just learned that top Kat works fine for winning, but not for grades. W, A, 15/4/3, 107/24. I think the optimal place is bot.
Have you tried rolling your face on the keyboard?

> [{quoted}](name=ElnyrJhodo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8VFGvaZ0,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2020-02-12T06:17:35.594+0000)
>
> Have you tried rolling your face on the keyboard?

Ha ha, yes, I know Kat is easy to play, but I'm competing against other Kat players, so I have to mash QWE faster than they do.
